message.content:
We begin by examining the statements that mention “David” and “Thomas.”

• The only statement with David is “David is Sophia's ancestor.”
• The only statement with Thomas is “Brandon is Thomas's descendant.”

Next we try to connect these parts of the family:
• The chain involving David shows that David is an ancestor of Sophia (and later, through further links, an ancestor of a branch of Sophia’s descendants).
• The chain involving Thomas shows that Thomas is an ancestor of Brandon (and with additional links, of Brandon’s descendants).

No statement in the list links any member of David’s branch (through Sophia or her descendants) with any member of Thomas’s branch (through Brandon or his descendants). There is no mention that David and Thomas are part of a larger connected family tree (sharing either a common descendant or a common ancestor), nor a direct descendant/ancestor connection between them.

Since we find no relationship tying David’s branch to Thomas’s branch, the correct answer is that none of the above options is correct.

<ANSWER>5</ANSWER>
